claim: If Codebase Community had hidden comment scores from all users, user ID 13 would not have altered the frequency of their negative comments.
reasoning: This is a counterfactual claim. It describes a hypothetical scenario ('If Codebase Community had hidden comment scores from all users') and speculates about user behavior under that scenario. The database only records what actually happened, not what would have happened under hypothetical platform changes.

content.text:
This claim is a counterfactual statement. It describes a hypothetical scenario: "If Codebase Community had hidden comment scores from all users..." and then speculates about what user ID 13 would or would not have done.

The database records what actually happened — it cannot tell us what would have happened under a hypothetical change to the platform's design. This is a classic counterfactual claim.
